# about

## Basic information

- Description
Years of potential life lost before age 75 per 100,000 population (age-adjusted).

- What is the numerator?
The numerator is the cumulative number of years of potential life lost from deaths among county residents under age 75, over a three-year period.

- What is the denominator?
The denominator is the aggregate population under age 75 for the three-year period.

## Raw data access

- NCHS mortality and natality data 2020-2022: the data is requested

- Census population estimates 2020-2022 from:

2020 Census Population Estimates: https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/popest/datasets/2010-2020/counties/asrh/CC-EST2020-ALLDATA.csv

2021 Census Population Estimates: https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/popest/datasets/2020-2021/counties/asrh/cc-est2021-all.csv

2022 Census Population Estimates: https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/popest/datasets/2020-2022/counties/asrh/cc-est2022-all.csv

## Subgroups

- non-Hispanic, White only, 
- non-Hispanic, Black only, 
- non-Hispanic, AIAN only, 
- non-Hispanic, Asian only, 
- non-Hispanic, NHOPI only, 
- non-Hispanic, Two or More Races
- Hispanic

## function: process pop data for v001 subgroups

```{r}
process_pop_v001_other <- function(year, by_race_TF = TRUE){
  pop <- read_census_pop(file_name = get_census_csv_file_info(year)$file_name ) %>%
    get_census_pop_by_agecat_race(get_census_csv_file_info(year)$year_num, by_race = by_race_TF, age_cat_version = "v001")
  
  return(pop)
}

```

## function: process mortality data for v001 subgroups

```{r}
process_mort_v001_other <- function(year, by_race_TF = TRUE){
  
  print(get_mort_file_name(year))
  
  mort <- read_mort_data(
    file_path = file.path(nchs_mort_dir, get_mort_file_name(year) ), 
    header = mort_header,
    n_max = Inf) %>% 
    get_mort_data_by_agecat_race(df_fips=fips, by_race = by_race_TF, age_cat_version = "v001")
  
  return(mort)
}
```

## Census pop data by race and age cat 1-7 for 2020-2022

```{r}
pop_agecat_1_7 <- bind_rows(
  process_pop_v001_other(2020),

  process_pop_v001_other(2022) %>% 
    fix_CT_pop(process_pop_v001_other(2021))
```

## combine age cat 0 with age cat 1-7

```{r}
pop_all <- 
  bind_rows(
    # age_cat = 2 to 7
    pop_agecat_1_7 %>% filter(age_cat!=1),
    
    # age_cat = 0
    c(1:6, 8) %>% 
      map_df(~mutate(fips %>% select(1:2), race = .)) %>% 
      mutate(age_cat = 0) %>% 
      left_join(infant_pop, by = c('statecode', 'countycode', 'race', 'age_cat')) %>% 
      mutate(pop = if_else(is.na(pop), 0, pop)),
    
    # fixed age_cat = 1
    pop_agecat_1_7 %>% 
      filter(age_cat==1) %>% 
      bind_rows(infant_pop) %>% 
      arrange(statecode, countycode, age_cat) %>% 
      pivot_wider(names_from = age_cat, values_from = pop, names_glue = "pop_{age_cat}") %>% 
      mutate(pop = if_else(is.na(pop_0), pop_1, pop_1 - pop_0)) %>% 
      select(-c(pop_0, pop_1)) %>% 
      mutate(age_cat = 1)
    ) %>% 
    arrange(statecode, countycode, race, age_cat) %>%
    # set negative pop as 0; example: 15005
    # mutate(pop = if_else(pop<0, 0, pop)) %>%
    # remove 02261
    filter(!(statecode == "02" & countycode == "261") ) 

pop_all  
```

## mort 2020-2022

```{r}
mort_all <- bind_rows(
  process_mort_v001_other(2020), 
  process_mort_v001_other(2021),
  process_mort_v001_other(2022)
  ) %>% 
  group_by(statecode, countycode, age_cat, race) %>% 
  summarise(deaths = sum(deaths), .groups = "drop") %>% 
  filter(age_cat != 99) %>% 
  filter(!is.na(race)) %>% 
  glimpse()
```

# mortality calculation

## merge mort and pop data

```{r}
merged <- pop_all %>%  
  left_join(mort_all %>% ungroup(), 
            by = c("statecode", "countycode", "age_cat", "race")) %>% 
  mutate(deaths = if_else(is.na(deaths), 0, deaths)) %>% 
  glimpse()
  
```

## add weight and years lost

```{r}
wtd <- 258059676 # /*population under 75; Census 2000 model*/

merged_3 <- merged %>% 
  mutate(wtn = get_age_wtn(age_cat, version = "v001"),
         yrlst = cal_years_lost_v001(age_cat)) %>% 
  mutate(wt = wtn/wtd,
         age_adj=deaths/pop*wtn/wtd*yrlst*100000,
         no_age_adj=deaths/pop*yrlst*100000,
         wk_var = (wt**2)*((no_age_adj**2)/(deaths))) %>% 
  group_by(statecode, countycode, race) %>% 
  summarise(numerator = sum(deaths, na.rm = TRUE),
            denominator = sum(pop, na.rm = TRUE),
            rawvalue = sum(age_adj, na.rm = TRUE), 
            # calculate std
            stdev = sqrt(sum(wk_var, na.rm = TRUE)),
            .groups = "drop") %>% 
  glimpse()
```

## confidence Intervals

```{r}
v001_1 <- merged_3 %>% 
  mutate(cilow = rawvalue - 1.96*stdev, 
         cihigh = rawvalue + 1.96*stdev,
         relative_standard_error = (stdev/rawvalue)) %>% 
  # select(-stdev) %>% 
  mutate(flag2 = if_else(relative_standard_error > 0.2, 
                         1, NA_real_)) %>% 
  mutate(flag2 = if_else(numerator < 20, 2, flag2)) %>% 
  mutate(across(c(numerator, denominator, rawvalue, cilow, cihigh), ~ as.double(.x))) %>% 
  mutate(across(c(numerator, denominator, rawvalue, cilow, cihigh), ~ if_else(!is.na(flag2) & flag2 == 2, 
                                            NA_real_, .x))) %>% 
  mutate(test_cb=round((rawvalue**2)/(stdev**2), digits = 0))

v001_1
```

## calculate CI L and U for v001_numerator < 100 


```{r}
v001_2 <- v001_1 %>% 
  left_join(get_pois_CI(), by = c("test_cb" = "n")) %>% 
  # mutate(flag2 = if_else(v001_numerator<20, 
  #                        2, flag2)) %>%
  mutate(cilow = if_else(numerator>=20 & numerator <=99,
                         rawvalue * L, cilow),
         cihigh = if_else(numerator>=20 & numerator <=99,
                         rawvalue * U, cihigh)) %>% 
  # mutate(v001_sourceflag = NA_real_) %>% 
  mutate(flag2 = if_else(relative_standard_error > 0.2 & flag2!=2, 
                         1, flag2)) %>% 
  select(-c(relative_standard_error, test_cb, L, U)) %>% 
  mutate(across(c(numerator, denominator, rawvalue, cilow, cihigh), ~ if_else(!is.na(flag2) & flag2 == 2, 
                                            NA_real_, .x))) %>% 
  rename(ypll_se=stdev, flag2_cb = flag2) %>% 
  # fix se for 15005
  mutate(ypll_se = if_else(statecode=="15" & countycode =="005",
                           NA_real_, ypll_se)) %>% 
  # replace inf with NA
  mutate(across(c(rawvalue, ypll_se), ~if_else(is.infinite(.), NA, .))) %>% 
  mutate(across(c(numerator, denominator, rawvalue, cilow, cihigh), ~ if_else(is.na(rawvalue), 
                                            NA_real_, .x))) 

v001_2
```

## suppression

When v001_other is calculated in SAS: County 20095 has an usually large YPLL value for the black population (>650,000). 
This happens for almost all of our mortality measures most years for this subpopulation in this county, 
and so we suppress this county's black value.

But in R, County 20095 has rawvalue of NA for black population. so suppression is not needed in R. But to be consistent with SAS, we need to chage 'flag2_cb' to 1 instead of NA
```{r}
v001_3 <- v001_2 %>% 
  mutate(flag2_cb = if_else(
    statecode == "20" & countycode == "095" & race ==2, 1, flag2_cb
  ))

```


## get subgroups

```{r}
v001_other <- process_race_data_wide(v001_3, fips, "v001") %>% 
  select(-c(starts_with('denominator'), starts_with('numerator'), 
            starts_with("ypll_se"), starts_with("flag2_cb")))

v001_other
```

- 'U' = data *unavailable* for a CT county

```{r}

  add_flag_CT(vnum = "v001_race", old="A", new = "U")
```
